intro: Vincetoxicum africanum, commonly known as African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its roots contain toxic compounds, which have been used traditionally in some regions for medicinal purposes. However, due to its poisonous nature, it requires careful handling.
